data.title: Paul Freeman

data.text:
Actors

Paul Freeman (born January 18, 1943) is an English actor who has appeared in theatre, television and film. In the United Kingdom, he is best known for his role in the romance TV series Yesterday’s Dreams (1987) as Martin Daniels. Internationally, he is known for playing the rival archaeologist René Belloq in Steven Spielberg‘s Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981), with Harrison Ford, Karen Allen, Ronald Lacey, John Rhys-Davies and Denholm Elliott; evil wine baron Gustav Riebmann on season 4 of the soap opera Falcon Crest (1984–85), with Jane Wyman; supervillain Ivan Ooze in Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie (1995), with Karan Ashley, Johnny Yong Bosch, Steve Cardenas, Jason David Frank, Amy Jo Johnson, and David Yost; Julius Morlang in Morlang (2001), Diana Kent; Ray in When I’m Sixty-Four (2004), with Alun Armstrong, Tamzin Outhwaite, and Jason Flemyng; Reverend Shooter in Edgar Wright‘s Hot Fuzz (2007), with Simon Pegg, Nick Frost, Jim Broadbent, Timothy Dalton, Billie Whitelaw, Edward Woodward, and Bill Nighy; and Shrewd Eddie in Hard Boiled Sweets (2012), with Elizabeth Berrington.

Other notable films in the 1980s include The Long Good Friday (1980), with Bob Hoskins and Helen Mirren; The Dogs of War (1980), with Christopher Walken and Tom Berenger; An Unsuitable Job for a Woman (1982), with Whitelaw and Pippa Guard; Shanghai Surprise (1986), with Sean Penn, Madonna, and Richard Griffiths; A World Apart (1988), with Barbara Hershey, David Suchet, Jeroen Krabbé, Tim Roth, and Jodhi May; and Without a Clue (1988), with Michael Caine and Ben Kingsley.

Eminent Domain (1990), with Donald Sutherland and Anne Archer: The Horsemen on the Roof (1995), with Juliette Binoche and Olivier Martinez; Double Team (1997), with Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dennis Rodman, and Mickey Rourke; Mrs Caldicot’s Cabbage War (2002), with Pauline Collins, John Alderton, and Peter Capaldi; George and the Dragon (2003), with James Purefoy, Piper Perabo, Patrick Swayze, Michael Clarke Duncan, Bill Treacher, Jean-Pierre Castaldi, Joan Plowright, and Simon Callow.

Each review will be linked to the title below.

(*seen originally in theaters)

(**seen rereleased in theaters)
